data.event: It was formed in 1811 and consists of 13 townships.
Some of the early settlers of this county were Primitive Baptists, they came with Elder William Tyner who came from Virginia in 1797.

event.title: built a log church as early as 1805

data.event: [1] The members built a log church as early as 1805, about two or three miles southeast of Brookville, Indiana.
In 1812 they built a large brick church, with balcony, and rifle ports.
The original church was established in 1817, as an arm of the Little Cedar Baptist church.
The plain, simple brick building, but impressive in its simplicity was built in 1838.

event.title: came upon the scene, modernism and human inventions, like Sunday

data.event: In the 1830s modernism came upon the scene, modernism and human inventions, like Sunday Schools, Missionary Societies, and organs.
The building is now maintained in connection with the Big Cedar Cemetery Association.[2]
